result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyler J. Renz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Transcript from 9/29/17 Sentencing After Revocation Hearing
DOC Balance Inquiry

Case called at 9:32 am (SF)
Defendant Tyler J. Renz in court, in custody with Attorney Roberto R Ledesma. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

ADA Hall advises that the Court previously stated that there was a discrepancy between the department's recommendation between their 2 filings.
ADA Hall and Attorney Ledesma advise they are ready to proceed.
Court advises that it has reviewed the transcript from the sentencing.

Counsel present sentencing arguments.

Court sentences Mr. Renz to 3 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  1 years & 6 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 1 years & 6 months.  This sentence is to commence consecutive to any sentence in being.

The Court finds that the Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and the Substance Abuse Program. 
The Court gives 201 days credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--no contact with Justin Allen
--Obtain/maintain fulltime gainful employment 
--No possession or consumption of illegal substances or paraphernalia associated with the use; sale or distribution of illegal substances
--no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no possession of a controlled substance without a valid prescription 
--successfully complete any classes or treatment that your agent deems appropriate
--to pay any outstanding costs and restitution 


Felony Firearm/Voting Restrictions Warnings Given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
Recess: 9:53 am
5-10-16 plea and sentencing hearing
No updated address information -  ( MG/08/21/17 )
Sentencing hearing on revocation on September 29, 2017 at 09:00 am.

records.addlTxt:
[MK] case called at 2:42pm. 
Defendant Tyler J. Renz in court with Attorney Joseph F Fischer.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " No Contest " entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified (ADA Hall submits the victim restitution information packet); the Court accepts the plea, finds Mr. Renz guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count # 2.

On Count # 1, the Court withholds sentence, and places Mr. Renz on Probation for two years. The Court will consider a petition to terminate Probation after one year if the Defendant has complied with all conditions or Proabtion; this is under Statute 973.09(3)(d).
Conditions of Probation are:  
--to serve 20 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with work-release privileges, to commence on  7/1/16 at 7:00pm.
---Mr. Renz is required to report for commencement and service of jail term with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his system; non-compliance will result in loss of work-release privileges without further process.
--to undergo Anger Management counseling
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, or counseling as required by the Agent
--no contact with Justin Allen except through a lawyer
--to attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--to pay restitution of $2,748.77 payable to Blue Cross-Blue Shield of Texas, located in Chicago IL 
--to pay the 10% restitution surcharge
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand
--to pay costs and surcharges including the $250 DNA surcharge 

Days credit for time already served:  0  days
Felony firearm prohibition warnings are given
recess 3:05pm.
Motion hearing on May 10, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Notice of intent to submit records
Notice of intent to admit statements submitte by the State w/cover letter
Motion to impeach
Scheduling
Jury trial on May 16, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on May 10, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

The Court notes that there is a single remaining Co-Defendant, so the cases are to be scheduled together for trial.

[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Tyler J. Renz in court with Attorney Mark A. Schoenfeldt. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Scheduling Notice

Case called at 2:35 pm [sf] (case was set for plea and sentencing hearing)
Defendant Tyler J. Renz in court with Attorney Mark A. Schoenfeldt. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney Schoefeldt advises that they are requesting that the case be set for Final Status and Jury Trial.
ADA Hall advises that this case would need a preliminary hearing before being set for trial. 
ADA Hall requests that this case be set with co-defendant Daniel Rechlin 15CF224, which is set for Preliminary Hearing on 1/15/16.
Attorney Schoefeldt is not available for that date.
Court will schedule Preliminary Hearings seperate, but wants the both cases set for Trial at the same time.

recess: 2:43 pm
NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)
Preliminary Hearing: 2/5/16 at 8:30 am  (JA please include note that case should be set with co-defendant 15CF224 for FSSC & JT)
Plea/sentencing hearing at 01-07-2016 02:30 pm

Case called at 2:53 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Tyler J. Renz not in court. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court reviews for the Court record that defense counsel called the Court's JA and indicated that he would be approximately 45 minutes late for today's hearing, which the Court approved. ADA Hall earlier indicated that they believed the matter had been rescheduled. Court for the record indicates that last conversation It is aware of is with the Court's JA who informed Atty Scheoenfeldt that if he wished for the matter to be adjourned, he need to submit a written stipulation to the Court. He asked to be transferred to the DAs office, which the Court's JA complied with.
Court directs Clerk to attempt to reach Atty Schoenfeldt via telephone
Atty Mark Schoenfeldt now appears by telephone - 2:57 pm 
Court has colloquy with Defense counsel re: resetting matters/reason for inability to appear - admonishes Counsel re: not following guidelines/procedure
Atty Schoenfeldt informs the Court that Mr. Renz does not appear because he informed him that a new date would be set & he need not appear today
ADA Hall informs the Court that the State has no objection to setting matter for plea/sentencing in January
Court excuses Defendant's non-appearance & continues bond
Recess: 3:04 pm 

NEXT: Schedule Plea/Sentencing 1/7/16 at 2:30 pm - Send notices
Status conference at 12-08-2015 02:30 pm
Scheduling Notice
